poem:
### Dunkelflaute Morning

Cold whispers of windless dawn,  
beneath grey canvas skies—  
the earth shivers beneath steel clouds;  
flickering gaslight warms  
unseen veins.  
  
In this breath-held pause,  
can the pulse sustain  
without the sun's glow  
or a breeze's whisper?  
Closed doors await,  
and we wrap ourselves  
in the caution of coming days.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Centrica may close UK’s largest gas storage site. Is the energy system really ready? | Nils Pratley Monday was another of those dunkelflaute days when the wind barely blows, the sun doesn’t shine and it’s cold. At times, gas-fired power stations were generating 70% of the UK’s electricity while windfarms and solar facilities were contributing as little as 7% combined. It was a reminder of why, even under the government’s rapid programme to decarbonise the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
